snippet: The company maintains that a distinct difference exists between its recall of 2.6 million older Chevrolet Cobalts and other cars, and has refused to expand a compensation fund, infuriating safety advocates.
abstract: General Motors maintains that distinct difference exists between its recall of 2.6 million older Chevrolet Cobalts and other vehicles and its more recent recall of 7.6 million cars like Chevrolet Malibu; refuses to expand fund set up to compensate victims, which infuriates safety advocates.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and REBECCA R. RUIZ

lead_paragraph: The company maintains that a distinct difference exists between its recall of 2.6 million older Chevrolet Cobalts and other cars, and has refused to expand a compensation fund, infuriating safety advocates.

headline.main: General Motors Resists Expanding Victims’ Fund
